Sample code is provided in both C# and VB. http://vbaccelerator.com/article.asp?id=15413 Sun, 27 Jun 2004 01:00:00 GMT New: WaveStreamReader and WaveStreamWriter http://vbaccelerator.com/home/NET/Code/Media/Audio/WaveStream/article.asp This article describes two classes which provide Stream wrappers around the Windows Multimedia API to work with .WAV files in .NET. These classes allow you to read and write .WAV files directly from managed code. Both C# and VB versions of the code are provided. http://vbaccelerator.com/article.asp?id=15506 Sun, 27 Jun 2004 01:00:00 GMT New: Image Mastering API (IMAPI) Wrapper for .NET http://vbaccelerator.com/home/NET/Code/Libraries/Writing_CDs/IMAPI/article.asp IMAPI is provided with Windows XP and above to provide full control over the creation of audio and data discs. This sample provides a wrapper around the API allowing it to be used from .NET; both VB and C# client code is provided. http://vbaccelerator.com/article.asp?id=15411 Sun, 27 Jun 2004 01:00:00 GMT New: STARBRIGHT World http://vbaccelerator.com/home/The_Site/vbAccelerator_Users/STARBRIGHT_World/article.asp STARBRIGHT World is a private online community for children living with serious illness. Whether they were expecting it or not, here it is: a VB application which creates audio CDs. http://vbaccelerator.com/article.asp?id=14970 Sat, 12 Jun 2004 01:00:00 GMT New: Using WinAmp In Plugins From VB http://vbaccelerator.com/home/VB/Code/vbMedia/Audio/Using_WinAmp_Plugins/article.asp Winamp is one of the better music player applications out there, and one of the neat features is its extensive support for plugins, most of which are developed and made available independently from Winamp. This article provides a small DLL and source which allows you to use these plugins to play and convert audio files relatively easily from VB. It has been tested with the MP3, MP4/AAC, APE (Monkey's Audio) and Ogg Vorbis plugins; it should work fine with the other plugins for more esoteric tracker and console formats out there too. http://vbaccelerator.com/article.asp?id=14973 Sat, 12 Jun 2004 01:00:00 GMT New: Simple Data CD Creation Using ICDBurn http://vbaccelerator.com/home/VB/Code/Libraries/Writing_CDs/Simple_CD_Burn/article.asp Windows XP and above include built-in support for burning CDs. Normally, this feature isn't used, and all applications run within the "Default" desktop. However, if you want to create a kiosk-style application which has a full-screen interface, and prevents Ctrl+Alt+Del or any of the other standard Windows options from being accessed, then this technique is the way to do it. http://vbaccelerator.com/article.asp?id=15313 Sat, 12 Jun 2004 01:00:00 GMT New: CD Ripping in VB Part 2 http://vbaccelerator.com/home/VB/Code/vbMedia/Audio/CD_Ripping_2/article.asp This sample provides a more sophisticated CD Ripper which is capable of writing MP3 files by adding the following: A plugin-based architecture for writing audio files.Implementing a WAV to MP3 encoder. An example is when burning a CD, as the CD burn will be terminated and the disc potentially ruined.
